LanguageData.GR_Mechabear.label: mechabear
LanguageData.GR_Mechabear.description: This cybernetic beast has been mutated far beyond its original form. Heavily armoured to withstand heavy fire, and armed with a terrifying plasma cannon.\n\n<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color>Mechanoid hybrids are always created with a controller booster, making the mechabear an effective weapons platform, akin to a rocket turret. Mechanoid hybrids need very little food or rest, don't have psychic or toxic sensitivity, and have devastating ranged attacks. They have however high wildness, making them harder to keep tamed, and they will need a mechahybrid antenna to be built somewhere on the planet, or their IFF sensors will malfunction in 5 days. One antenna is needed for each five mech hybrids under the colony's control.

LanguageData.GR_Mechamime.label: mecha-mime
LanguageData.GR_Mechamime.description:
The ultimate violation of all ethical concerns in genetic engineering: a humanlike mechanoid creature with obvious malevolence. Created by warping humanoid genes into a dangerous Mime, and then further modifying it with self-replicating mechanites by using forgotten technology, the mecha-mime will need to be kept in a short leash, lest its IFF system goes haywire and decides to enact its very own judgement day.

<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color>Mechanoid hybrids are always created with a controller booster. The mecha-mime has lost the infiltration abilities of a regular mime, but in exchange it possesses a powerful spatial warping cannon that ignores enemy's armor. Mechanoid hybrids need very little food or rest, don't have psychic or toxic sensitivity, and have devastating ranged attacks. They have however high wildness, making them harder to keep tamed, and they will need a mechahybrid antenna to be built somewhere on the planet, or their IFF sensors will malfunction in 5 days. One antenna is needed for each five mech hybrids under the colony's control.

<color=#E5E54C>Warning:</color> A mecha-mime's IFF sensors will fail in only 2 days, instead of 5.
